newsitem.title: FRANCE: Tietmeyer-EMU pact needs near-automatic sanctions.
newsitem.headline: Tietmeyer-EMU pact needs near-automatic sanctions.

text.p: Bundesbank President Hans Tietmeyer said in an interview with afternoon daily Le Monde that a budget stability pact to be introduced after the launch of a single European currency should include quasi-automatic sanctions.

Finance ministers meeting in Dublin last month agreed in principle on a stability pact to stop countries easing up on fiscal discipline after the launch of monetary union. This will include fines on those who overshoot deficit ceilings.
"As regards the sanctions mechanism, it would be good for this to be based on the principle of quasi-automaticity," Tietmeyer said.

"In Dublin, the representatives of all countries in the European Union agreed that a country which has an excessive deficit will always -- and I stress always -- be subject to sanctions if it does not correct its policies within a period of time, which must be short," he said.
